text: So far, I've gone with setting up unique foreign ID columns for each of my cross pollinating tables
Does anyone happen to know if the value returned from an empty foreignID field is an empty array `[ ]` or is it a `null` value?
I think I've answered my own question. For anyone interested... it seems to return as `null`

I have a support ticket open for this, but is anyone else seeing `This oauth-token (my-token-here) does not have proper permissions! (cannot access an unscoped endpoint` when using the GET hubdb table API?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table>
`GET <https://api.HubSpot.com/hubdb/api/v2/tables/:tableId?portalId=:portalId>`

My OAuth token has the `hubdb` scope and can do everything else on the HubDB API (get all tables, create tables, delete tables, publish tables).
This just started happening last week sometime. We have a few applications deployed that use HubDB API and just started seeing these errors a few days ago.
might throw this in the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel
